compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils module¶

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.adopted_sigmoid(delta, x)[source]¶

Adopted sigmoid function ref: https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.09789

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • delta (float) – a scalar whihch scales

Returns:

gap_n – gap in normal direction

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.calculate_gap_in_normal_direction(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates the gap in normal direction.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

gap_n – gap in normal direction

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.calculate_gap_in_normal_direction_3d(x, y, X)[source]¶

Calculates the gap in normal direction in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – The input arguments (coordinates x, y, and z).

  • y (tensor) – The network output (predicted displacement in x, y, and z directions).

  • X (np.array) – The input arguments as an array (coordinates x, y, and z).

Returns:

gap_n – Gap in normal direction in 3D.

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.calculate_gap_in_normal_direction_deep_energy(x, y, X, mapped_normal_boundary_t, cond)[source]¶

Calculates the gap in normal direction in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – The input arguments (coordinates x, y, and z).

  • y (tensor) – The network output (predicted displacement in x, y, and z directions).

  • X (np.array) – The input arguments as an array (coordinates x, y, and z).

Returns:

gap_n – Gap in normal direction in 3D.

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.negative_normal_traction_adopted_sigmoid(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces normal part of contact traction (Pn) to be negative using an adopted sigmoid function based on https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.09789. KKT condition: Pn<=0

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

adopted_sigmoid(delta_pressure,Pn)*Pn – non-zero tensor if Pn is positive, otherwise returns zero-tensor

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.negative_normal_traction_sign(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces normal part of contact traction (Pn) to be negative using the sign function. KKT condition: Pn<=0

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

(1.0+tf.math.sign(Pn))*Pn – non-zero tensor if Pn is positive, otherwise returns zero-tensor

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.positive_normal_gap_adopted_sigmoid(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces normal gap (gn) to be positive using an adopted sigmoid function based on https://arxiv.org/abs/2203.09789. KKT condition: gn>=0

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

adopted_sigmoid(delta_gap,-gn)*gn – non-zero tensor if gn is negative, otherwise returns zero-tensor (not a sharp function)

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.positive_normal_gap_sign(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces normal gap (gn) to be positive using the sign function. KKT condition: gn>=0

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

(1.0-tf.math.sign(gn))*gn – non-zero tensor if gn is negative, otherwise returns zero-tensor

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.zero_complementarity_function_based_fischer_burmeister(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces KKT conditions using a complementarity function called Fischer-Burmeister based on ref https://www.math.uwaterloo.ca/~ltuncel/publications/corr2007-17.pdf. This function is mathematically equal to combination of the following functions:

  • positive_normal_gap_sign

  • negative_normal_traction_sign

  • zero_complimentary

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

Pn-tf.math.maximum(tf.constant(0, dtype=tf.float32), Pn-c_complementarity*gn) –

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.zero_complementarity_function_based_fischer_burmeister_3d(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces KKT conditions using a complementarity function called Fischer-Burmeister based on ref https://www.math.uwaterloo.ca/~ltuncel/publications/corr2007-17.pdf. This function is mathematically equal to combination of the following functions:

  • positive_normal_gap_sign

  • negative_normal_traction_sign

  • zero_complimentary

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

Pn-tf.math.maximum(tf.constant(0, dtype=tf.float32), Pn-c_complementarity*gn) –

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.zero_complementarity_function_based_popp(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces KKT conditions using a complementarity function based on https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/nme.2614. This function is mathematically equal to combination of the following functions:

  • positive_normal_gap_sign

  • negative_normal_traction_sign

  • zero_complimentary

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

Pn-tf.math.maximum(tf.constant(0, dtype=tf.float32), Pn-c_complementarity*gn) –

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.zero_complimentary(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces complimentary term to be zero. KKT condition: gn*Pn=0

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

gn*Pn – matrix multiplication between normal gap (gn) and normal pressure (Pn)

Return type:

tensor

compsim_pinns.contact_mech.contact_utils.zero_tangential_traction(x, y, X)[source]¶

Enforces tangential component of contact traction (Tt) to be zero.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – the input arguments (coordinates x and y)

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

Tt – tangential component of contact traction (Tt)

Return type:

tensor

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)

  • X (np.array) – the input arguments as an array (coordinates x and y)

Returns:

  • y (tensor) – the network output (predicted displacement in x and y direction)
